title: Can a lender consider your age when deciding whether to give you a mortgage or home equity loan?
main_content: However, there are exceptions to this rule. For example, age can be considered in a valid credit scoring system but it canâ€™t disfavor applicants 62 years old or older. However, the scoring system may favor applicants 62 years or older.Age will be considered when applying for a Home Equity Conversion Mortgage , which is a type of Reverse Mortgage.In addition, a lender may relate your age to other information about you that the lender considers in evaluating creditworthiness. For example, a lender may consider your job and length of time to retirement to determine whether your income (including your retirement income) will be adequate for the life of the loan.
key_message: Generally, a creditor such as a lender cannot use your age to make credit decisions.
